```{r}
library(ggplot2)
books<- read.csv("books.csv")
books$num_pages <- as.numeric(books$num_pages)
books$average_rating <- as.numeric(books$average_rating)
```

original code
```{r}
ggplot(books, aes(x= average_rating)) + geom_histogram(stat="bin", binwidth = 0.05, fill="cornflowerblue",color="black") + xlab("Average Rating (0-5)") + ylab("Number of Ratings (millions)")
```

assigning colors og
```{r}
colors <- c(0:5)
r<-0:2.9
y<-3:3.9
g<-4:5
assign.colors <- function(color.in){
colors.as.numbers <- switch(color.in,
  "red" = r,
  "yellow"= y,
  "green"= g
  )
return(assign.colors)
}
```


colors: ave rating <2 red
        2.5-3.5=yellow
        3.6-5 green
if else as conditional (nested)
for loop with conditional
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
red <- subset(books, average_rating[0:2.5] == "poorratings")
yellow <- subset(books, average_rating[2.6:] == "yellow")
green <- subset(books, average_rating == "green")

ggplot(books, mapping=aes(x= average_rating)) + geom_histogram(stat = "bin", binwidth = 0.05 , fill = colors <- c(1:5),
,color=assign.colors) + xlab("Average Rating (0-5)") + ylab("Number of Ratings (millions)")
```
